metadata.Title: CVE-2021-45079 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - high.
metadata.Description:
In strongSwan before 5.9.5, a malicious responder can send an EAP-Success message too early without actually authenticating the client and (in the case of EAP methods with mutual authentication and EAP-only authentication for IKEv2) even without server authentication.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-45079` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

charon-cmd - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
charon-systemd - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
libcharon-extauth-plugins - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
libstrongswan - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
strongswan - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
strongswan-charon - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
strongswan-libcharon - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
strongswan-nm - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
strongswan-pki - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
strongswan-scepclient - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
strongswan-starter - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
strongswan-swanctl - 5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: strongswan package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9.1-1ubuntu3.2').
